record.description: Using a chart and Springfield rifle of World War I vintage, chief instructor Russell Wiles Jr. explains the mechanism and care of weapons. Wooden gun experts! Training with wooden guns, riflemen are being turned out on a mass production basis at the field house of the University of Chicago! Students are mainly men who plan to enter armed forces and seek basic military training…in easy doses. Only 100 rounds of ammunition are used during the entire course and 40 of these cartridges are shot during the final exam. They get so much practice with a wooden gun that when they actually get their hands on a rifle they score in the expert class.
